summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2021 between a Federal Express paralegal and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding obtaining a records custodian to authenticate FedEx records for the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss a subpoena from 2008 related to Jeffrey Epstein and the need for an affidavit or trial testimony.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal at Federal Express Corporation Legal Department
persons.context: FedEx paralegal corresponding with prosecutors about authenticating FedEx records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. She reviews records and discusses whether someone needs to sign an affidavit or appear at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming trial in New York mentioned by the prosecutor. The FedEx records are being authenticated for use in her trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by Tracy Chapell in an email asking if the records pertain to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the records are related to his case.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

persons.name: Erin
persons.role: Unknown (likely law enforcement or legal colleague)
persons.context: Email sender who connects Tracy Chapell with the Assistant United States Attorney, noting Chapell has been helpful in the past.

connections.description: Communicating about authenticating FedEx records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, with Chapell providing records and discussing affidavit or testimony needs.
Implied connection as Maxwell's trial involves records related to Epstein, based on Chapell's question about whether the records pertain to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.person2: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
connections.description: Ferrara was the FedEx point of contact for a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office in February 2008.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell trial scheduled
events.description: Trial of Ghislaine Maxwell scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx from SD Florida
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008, with Tracy Ferrara as the point of contact.

locations: Memphis, TN 38125 (Federal Express Corporation Legal Department, 3620 Hack Cross Road Building B, 3rd Floor)
New York, New York 10007 (Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza)
keyFacts: Prosecutors in July 2021 were seeking a FedEx records custodian to authenticate records for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
A subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein was sent to FedEx by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.
The FedEx point of contact for the 2008 subpoena was Tracy Ferrara.
The emails show ongoing evidence gathering for Maxwell's trial, indicating the use of documentary evidence like shipping records.
Tracy Chapell explicitly asks if the records pertain to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein, confirming the connection to his case.
